meanings.definition: A serf or slave in ancient Sparta.
meanings.sent1: The helot worked hard in the fields under the orders of the Spartan masters.
meanings.sent2: The helot carried out tasks for the Spartans without any freedom.
meanings.sent3: The helot tried to sneak away from work but was caught by the Spartan overseer.
meanings.sent4: The helot's life was bound by chains of servitude to the Spartan rulers.
meanings.sent5: The helot's existence was like a shadow, always under the control of others.

meanings.definition: A person in a subordinate or servile position.
meanings.sent1: She felt like a helot in the presence of her demanding boss.
meanings.sent2: The helot of the office had to do all the menial tasks for little recognition.
meanings.sent3: The helot of the group was always the one cleaning up after everyone else.
meanings.sent4: He was treated like a helot, constantly pushed around by those in power.
meanings.sent5: Being the helot of the team meant always being at the bottom of the hierarchy.
